intro: Lycopodioides obesa, commonly known as the fat clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the order Lycopodiales. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant produces small, scale-like leaves and has a unique reproductive structure called a strobilus, which contains the sporophytes. Lycopodioides obesa is an important component of understory vegetation in temperate and subtropical regions. Its evolutionary significance lies in its ancient lineage, dating back to the early development of vascular plants.
